Summary: The hotel is located in the Haidian district, near the last metro stop, and requires a taxi to reach it. It is not close to historic sites, but is near a large shopping center and restaurants.

The Ascott Beijing is centrally located in the CBD, within walking distance of the train station, food places, and a 7-Eleven, and about a 10-15 minute walk to the silk market. Some main attractions are about 20 minutes away, but the hotel is not specifically a tourist hotel and is located about a 10 minute walk from the Guo Mao subway station.

The Autumn Garden Hotel is located in a hutong (traditional alleyway) near Tiananmen Square, offering a quiet environment amidst the busy city. It is within walking distance of the subway and major attractions like the Temple of Heaven and Forbidden City.

The Bamboo Garden Hotel is located in a hutong, offering a quiet and peaceful environment with courtyards and gardens; it's within walking distance to lakes and close to the subway for city access. Some rooms offer garden views.
The Century Towers Beijing hotel offers apartment-style rooms with full kitchens and washer/dryers. It is located across the street from a large supermarket.
The hotel is located about a 30-minute walk from Tiananmen Square and close to a metro station. Some rooms offer views of the city.

The Far East Hotel is located in a hutong, about 20 minutes walk from Tiananmen Square and close to the Forbidden City and Temple of Heaven. It offers tours to the Great Wall and is near local shops and restaurants.

The Friendship Hotel is a large complex with multiple buildings in a garden setting, offering a peaceful environment away from the city's chaos, though it is situated on the third ring road and requires taxi rides to reach city sites. It is near Peking University, Tsinghua University, Zhongguancun High Tech district, and the Summer Palace, with a major department store, restaurants, and shopping mall nearby.

The hotel is located off the 3rd Ring road (San Huan) with moderate traffic and adjacent to a food street, and is within walking distance of the US and Japanese embassies. Rooms are modern and hi-tech with LCD TVs.

The Beijing Hotel is centrally located near Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City, with some rooms offering views of the Forbidden City. It is close to the Wangfujing shopping street and a subway stop, but the airport is quite far.

The Beijing International Hotel is centrally located within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Wangfujing Street, and across the street from a shopping mall. Some rooms offer views of the Beijing Railway Station.

The hotel is located near the Forbidden City, Tiananmen Square, and other major sights, with easy access to public transportation. It is also close to the Night Market and within walking distance of parks.
Sihe Hotel is located in a traditional Hutong neighborhood in central Beijing, within walking distance to the Forbidden City. It features a courtyard garden offering a peaceful environment.

The Radegast Beijing is located in the Central Business District in the ChaoYang district, about a 10-minute walk to the XinGuangTianDi mall and a subway station, with some restaurants and high-end shopping malls within walking distance. Although located in a quieter area, it is a short taxi ride to the city center.
The Capital Hotel is within walking distance of Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City, and some rooms have views of the city and mountains. The hotel organizes excursions to the Great Wall.

The China World Hotel is located in the Chaoyang district of Beijing, close to a subway stop for easy access to tourist sites and near the China World shopping mall. Some rooms offer cityscape views, and the hotel has a gym and pool.

City Hotel is located centrally in Beijing, close to bars, restaurants catering to foreigners, and a subway station providing access to Tiananmen Square, the Forbidden City, and other areas. Access to the street requires walking through construction and what smells like open sewage.

The Commune by the Great Wall offers a location in a valley near the Great Wall, about 1-1.5 hours from Beijing. It features architecturally unique villas, a private section of the Great Wall, restaurants, and spa facilities.

Courtyard 7 is located in a renovated courtyard in the old part of Beijing, within walking distance of Hohai Lake, Beihai Park and the Forbidden City, and a short walk to Qianhai Lake. The hotel is located off Nanluoguxiang, a tree-lined street with shops, bars and restaurants.

The hotel is conveniently located near a subway station, close to Wangfujing, Forbidden City, and Tiananmen Square. There are cars for hire outside the hotel for day trips to the Great Wall and Ming Tombs.
The hotel is located between the city center and the airport, about 20 minutes by cab from the airport, and about 10 minutes from downtown without traffic. It is not particularly close to nature.

The Crowne Plaza Beijing is located on Wangfujing Street, a central shopping area, and is within walking distance or a short taxi ride to Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. Some reviewers noted that you could arrange day trips to the Great Wall through the concierge.

The hotel is near the Summer Palace, Peking University, and Tsinghua University, and a subway ride away from the Olympic "Bird Nest," Forbidden Palace, and Tiananmen. It is located about 45 minutes from the city center by subway.

The hotel is located close to the airport and exhibition center, but is far from the city center, requiring a 40-minute to over an hour taxi ride. The hotel is in an industrial area with not many amenities nearby.
The Crowne Plaza Wuzhou is located near the Olympic Park and about 30-45 minutes by taxi from the city center. It is also within walking distance of a small mall with a supermarket and food court.

The Crowne Plaza Sun Palace Hotel is located on the third ring road in Beijing's North East, a short walk from the Shaoyaoju subway station (lines #2 and #10), with construction surrounding the area. Some reviewers mention views of construction, but also proximity to the subway for access to the city.

The Days Inn Forbidden City is located near a park, and is within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square. It is also close to subway and bus stops that go to other places of interest like the Summer Palace.

The hotel is located in a newly built commercial area, not near an underground station, and about a 15-20 minute walk to main sites. Some reviews mention bus lines in front of the hotel that provide access to the CiQiKou subway and GuoMao Carrefour supermarket.

The Double Happiness Courtyard Hotel is located in a traditional Hutong neighborhood, offering a taste of local Beijing life. It is within walking distance to the subway and close to shops and restaurants.
The Doubletree Hilton Beijing is located outside the 2nd Ring Road, not close to major sites or a subway station, but near bus stops. It has a 3rd-floor outdoor roof garden with a swimming pool.

The Empark Grand Hotel is located in the northwest part of the city, with the Summer Palace being the closest attraction. The hotel is not located in a walkable part of town, and the city center is a 20-30 minute taxi ride away.
The Fujian Hotel is located on the 3rd ring road, near a mall with a supermarket and food options, and about 20-30 minutes from the airport. The hotel is easily accessible to other parts of Beijing.

The Gloria Plaza Hotel is located in central Beijing, within walking distance of the Beijing railway station and an underground station. Some rooms have a view of an ancient tower and the old Beijing city wall.

The Grand Hotel is centrally located, within walking distance to the Forbidden City, Tiananmen Square, and Wangfujing shopping area, and adjacent to gardens east of the Forbidden City. Some rooms offer views of the Forbidden City.

The Grand Hyatt Beijing is located in the heart of the city near shopping and tourist attractions, and some reviewers appreciated the indoor pool. Some reviewers recommend hiring a driver to visit the Great Wall and Ming Tombs.
The Grand Mercure Hotel Xidan Beijing is near the Xidan subway station and Xuanwumen station, and is a 15-20 minute walk to Tiananmen Square. There are Hutongs with restaurants located nearby.

The hotel is located in the Central Business District and near a subway station, providing access to both the city and attractions outside of it like the Great Wall and Summer Palace. The hotel is near Ritan Park and Hutongs, and some rooms offer views of the CCTV building.

The Grand View Garden Hotel is located a distance from the city center, but next to a park with free entry for hotel residents. It also has a garden at the back that is well worth a visit, and is based on the Chinese classic "The Dream of the Red Mansion".

The hotel is located near the Beijing Pedestrian Road, a 15-20 minute walk to Tienanmen Square & the Forbidden City, and close to shops and restaurants. It is also near the subway, with one stop to Tienanmen Square and three stops to Wangfujing shopping area.

The Harmony Hotel is located near the Beijing Railway Station and subway, offering convenient access to city attractions like Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City (20-25 minute walk). Some reviewers mention nearby hutongs (alleys) that are fun to explore.

Hebei Guest House is located in a traditional hutong neighborhood, offering an authentic feel with proximity to the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square. Some rooms overlook a courtyard with a water feature, providing a quiet atmosphere despite being close to city attractions.

The Hilton Beijing is located near the Lufthansa Center and a subway station that provides easy access to city attractions; taxi service is readily available to reach destinations such as the Forbidden City and the Great Wall. While the hotel's immediate neighborhood may not have major sightseeing opportunities within walking distance, it offers convenient transportation options for exploring both the city center and natural attractions.

The Hilton Wangfujing is located in the center of Beijing, close to Wangfujing shopping street, Tiananmen Square, and the Forbidden City. Hutongs are nearby, offering a taste of traditional Chinese lifestyle.
The hotel is located close to the airport and about 20 minutes from Tian Anmen and Olympic Park. It is not located in the city center but is near tree-lined neighborhoods with parks and local shops.

The Holiday Inn Central Plaza is located a bit outside the city center, but reviewers mention that the Mutianyu and Simitai sections of the Great Wall are accessible, with one reviewer describing the rural surroundings of Mutianyu. The hotel is near a bus terminus for travel into the city, and reviewers note a nearby park and river for outdoor recreation.

The Holiday Inn Chang An West is located on the west side of Beijing, outside of the city center but near the 4th ring road, making it well-placed for accessing the Summer Palace and the Great Wall. It is also located near a subway station that provides access to the city center.

The hotel is located on the northwest edge of the second ring road, not far from the zoo, and close to a subway stop for access to Tiananmen Square. It is also on the side of the city closest to the Summer Palace.

The hotel is located near the Olympic Park and within walking distance of a subway station, offering access to the city center, and is close to the Ethnic Minority People's Park. Some rooms overlook an atrium, while others have outside views.

The Holiday Inn Express Temple of Heaven is located near the Temple of Heaven, with some rooms offering views of construction sites. It is not centrally located but offers convenient taxi access to the city center and is within walking distance of parks and hutongs.

The Holiday Inn Express Wangjing is located a 20-25 minute taxi ride from the Olympic stadiums and a 25 minute taxi ride from the Summer Palace. It is situated next to the Hua Tang Shopping Center, across the road from the Stellar International Cineplex, and not too far from the city sites via public transport.

The Holiday Inn Temple of Heaven is located in a residential area of Beijing, about a 10-15 minute walk to the Temple of Heaven park and a 10-minute walk to the nearest subway station, providing access to the city. The hotel is also near local shops and restaurants.
The hotel is located at the end of a street with major building construction, which occurs into the night and early morning hours. The location was not commented on in terms of city or nature access.

Hotel Cote Cour SL is located in a quiet hutong in the center of Beijing, within walking distance of subway stations, shopping centers, and major sightseeing spots. It has a courtyard for relaxation and is near bars and the city.
Hotel G is located in the Chaoyang district, which is in the city center and close to bars, clubs, restaurants, and shopping. The hotel can arrange excursions to the Great Wall.

The Ibis Sanyuan Hotel is located near the Sanyuanqiao subway station, the first stop from the airport train, providing easy access to both the airport and Beijing city. Although not centrally located, the subway provides convenient and cheap access to major sites and the Olympic Park.
The Kunlun Hotel has a revolving restaurant on the top floor with city views. The hotel is located in an area that some found inconvenient for accessing tourist attractions.

The New Otani Chang Fu Gong Hotel is centrally located on Chang An Avenue, with easy access to the Line 1 and Line 2 subway station, and contains a health club with a squash court, indoor swimming pool, fitness room, soaking tubs, and saunas. The hotel overlooks a peaceful inner Japanese garden and is near the Silk Market and Friendship Store.

The Howard Johnson Paragon is conveniently located near the Beijing Railway Station and a subway exit, offering easy access to the city. Some reviewers mentioned views from the room, though the quality of the view varies, and the hotel is not specifically located near nature.
I'm sorry, but the reviews for this hotel don't contain any information about nature or scenery. The hotel is close to the airport, Lufthansa Centre, Sanlitun bar Street, and embassy districts.

The Hua Wei Business Appartment Hotel is centrally located in a busy shopping district and within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square. It is near a subway station and has a taxi stand outside.

The Intercontinental Beijing Beichen is located near the Olympic Green, offering views of the Bird's Nest and Water Cube, and is a short walk to these venues. It is located a 30-45 minute subway ride or taxi from the city center.

The Intercontinental Beijing Financial Street is located about 4 miles from Central Beijing, and a 15-20 minute taxi ride to almost anywhere in the CBD. There is a subway station a 5-10 minute walk away, and is a short cab ride away from the hutongs of Houhai.
The Jade Garden Hotel is located within walking distance of the Forbidden City, Tiananmen Square, and Beihai Park. It is also close to shopping districts and restaurants.

The hotel has a garden view with a small terrace overlooking a fish pond and trees. Some rooms have a balcony with a view, and there is an exercise room with a view over the courtyard gardens and pools.

The hotel is located near gardens with ducks and is a short taxi ride away from Tiananmen Square and the Temple of Heaven. It is also a 20-minute walk to the nearest metro station, providing access to major attractions.

Jinqiao Hotel Apartments is located near the second ring road, about a 50-minute drive to the airport and a 2-hour drive to the Great Wall. It is also about a 10-minute drive to the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square.
Joy City Hotel is located next to the Joy City shopping mall and is a short walk to the subway and Xi'dan shopping center. Some suites include a kitchen with a washing machine and a stove top cooker.

The JW Marriott Beijing is located near the CBD, close to a subway stop for easy access to the Forbidden City and other attractions, and within walking distance of a shopping mall. The hotel is not particularly close to nature.

Hotel Kapok is near the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square, with some rooms offering small gardens or courtyards and proximity to local eateries and night markets. It is also within walking distance of shopping areas.

Kelly's Courtyard is located in a hutong area, a short walk from a main street with buses and taxis, and a 15-minute walk to a subway line. It features a glass-covered courtyard, a rooftop terrace, and is near the Xidan shopping area.

The Kempinski Hotel is located close to the subway, with Chaoyang Park a 10-minute walk away, and has a courtyard garden, providing access to both city and nature. The hotel is also connected to the Lufthansa Shopping Centre.

The Kuntai Royal Hotel is located within Beijing's inner ring road, a 15-minute walk or 5-minute taxi ride to the Sanlitun entertainment area; it is also across the street from the Tao Temple/Cultural Center. The hotel has a pool and is within walking distance of restaurants, ATMs, a supermarket, and a clothing bazaar, with the Forbidden City a 10-minute taxi ride away.

Lee Gardens Service Apartment is located in the Wangfujing area, close to shopping, markets, restaurants, and the subway, and within walking distance of the Forbidden City. It offers apartments with kitchens and amenities like a gym and pool.

The Legendale Hotel in Beijing is located near a shopping center, Starbucks, and various dining options, with the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square being a 15-20 minute walk away. It is equipped with an indoor pool and a health club that includes jacuzzies, a steam bath, and a sauna.

The Loong Palace Hotel is located in the Chang Ping district, outside the 5th ring highway, about 30 minutes from downtown Beijing, close to the Great Wall and Ming Tombs. It has excellent facilities including indoor tennis courts, a bowling alley, a recreation center/gymnasium, a pool, and a spa.

The Luxury Serviced Residence is located in the embassy area of Beijing, close to the Chaoyang commercial district and within walking distance of the Silk Market. It is near subway and bus lines providing access to city attractions, but also has a 7-Eleven nearby for convenience.

The Marco Polo Parkside is located a 15-minute walk to the subway and a 30-minute walk to the Bird's Nest Olympic Stadium and park where the "Chinese relax and play." It is a taxi ride away from the city center, but near a supermarket and restaurants.

The Marriott West Beijing is located on the west side of the city, a 30-45 minute taxi ride to the San Li Tun district, with a Subway, Baskin Robbins, Pizza Hut, and noodle shop nearby. Some rooms have views of the CCTV tower, and the hotel is connected to a Bally's Fitness Center.

The Marriott Executive Apartments Beijing is located in the Chaoyang district, on the outskirts of the city. The Sandalwood museum is across the street, and the Forbidden City is 30-40 minutes away by taxi.

The hotel is located near a park with remnants of the city wall and is within walking distance of two subway stops, providing access to both nature and the city. It is also close to the Beijing Railway station.

The Mercure Wanshang is located away from the noise of Beijing streets, near "ring five" and accessible from the airport. It is a few minutes walk away from a subway station that will take you to the Forbidden City area in about 20-30 minutes.

Michael's House is located in a real Beijing neighborhood, a 10-15 minute walk from the subway, and near lakes; some rooms have computers and free internet. The hotel is not located in a touristy area, giving guests the chance to experience local lifestyle.

Motel 268 Wangfujing is located on Wangfujing Street, near shopping areas, a night food market, and the Dengshikou subway station. It is within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square.

The New World Hotel is located in the Chaoyang District, near the Chaoyang theater, with easy access to the subway for a 10-15 minute ride to the Silk Market and Tiananmen Square. Some rooms, especially corner rooms, offer a view of the city.

The New Century Hotel is located in Beijing's west end near the Panda Zoo and Purple Bamboo Park, a taxi ride away from the city center like Tiananmen Square. Some reviewers noted views of office blocks rather than tourist sights.

The Novotel Peace Beijing is located in the center of the city, within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Wangfujing shopping street, and a short taxi ride from other attractions; some rooms offer views of the Forbidden City. The hotel has a small pool and is near the subway, providing easy access to other parts of Beijing.

The Novotel Xinqiao is conveniently located near the Chongwenmen subway station, making it easy to access various parts of the city, including Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City, while also offering tours to the Great Wall. Some reviewers mentioned pleasant walks to the Temple of Heaven, as well as local restaurants and shopping centers near the hotel.

Oakwood Residence Beijing is located on the Eastern 3rd ring road, providing access to most places in town, and is a 5-minute walk to the subway. The hotel is next to modern shopping malls, restaurants, and bars, but not within walking distance to landmarks.

The hotel is located close to the subway, about a 15-20 minute walk to the Olympic stadium/Bird's Nest, and approximately 30 minutes by taxi to downtown Beijing. A WU mart (like a mini Walmart) is nearby for shopping.

The Oriental Bay International Hotel is located on the 2nd or 3rd ring road with a canal in front, near a metro station for easy access to Beijing central. It is close to the Temple of Heaven, Lama Temple, and Olympic stadiums.

The Beijing Oriental Culture Hotel is centrally located and close to transport, with a subway station a few blocks away. It is near the Lama Temple and Confucius Temple, with restaurants and supermarkets within walking distance.

The hotel is located next to a garden complex that is free to hotel guests and offers a central point for early morning exercises. It is also a 10-minute taxi ride from Tian'anmen Square and the Forbidden City.

The Marriott Palm Springs is located across the road from Chaoyang Park, which is enormous and a lovely place to wander, and is a cheap cab ride into the tourist parts of the city. The hotel is located within one of the most upscale apartment compounds in Beijing, and the garden inside the compound is enormous and fantastic to walk around.

The Park Hyatt Beijing offers great city views from its sky lobby, rooms, spa, and restaurants on the top floors of the Yintai Centre. The hotel is located near subway lines and is within walking distance of the Silk Market.
The hotel is a 15-20 minute walk from Wangfujing Street and the Forbidden City. It is centrally located to a variety of attractions and near the Dengshikou subway.
The hotel is located about 10-15 minutes by taxi from the city center. One side of the hotel faces a school area and some residential areas.

The hotel is located on one of Beijing's ring roads, a short and cheap taxi ride away from the city's major sites, but a long walk to the nearest subway station. There is a restaurant opposite the hotel and a pocket of hutongs and a market about fifteen minutes away.

The hotel is located at the north end of Wangfujing shopping street, about a half-hour walk to Tiananmen Square and shorter to the Forbidden City, but some rooms offer views of the city or mountains. The hotel can arrange trips to the Great Wall and is near hutongs and waterfront bars.

The hotel is located a short walk from the subway, which provides access to the city center in 20-30 minutes, and is near Fragrant Park. It is located on the southwest side of the city, near ring road 5.

The hotel is located on a busy street with many restaurants and is a 5-15 minute walk from two subway stations, with one station providing a bus to the Mutianyu Great Wall. It is also located within a 10-minute walk of the Lama Temple, Confucian Temple, and Imperial Academy.

The Raffles Beijing is centrally located near Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City, with a subway station nearby for easy access to other parts of the city. Some rooms have views of the city, while others overlook construction sites.

The hotel is located in the Chaoyang District, near the 3rd Ring Road, with convenient access to a subway line and a shopping mall. While not in the city center and not within walking distance of tourist sights, it's a short taxi ride away, with a location that provides convenient access to main roads.

The Renaissance Beijing is located in the northeast part of the city, about a 15-minute taxi ride to the subway and a 30-45 minute drive to the Forbidden City area, but near the airport expressway and local restaurants/bars. The hotel is also near the embassy district and an indoor flower market.

The Shangri-La Beijing is situated in a garden setting, offering a tranquil escape, but is located far from the city center requiring taxi rides to reach major attractions. Some rooms offer views of the gardens, while others overlook a highway intersection.

The Kerry Centre is located in the CBD, a short taxi ride away from Olympic stadia, and a 5-minute walk to the Guomao subway station via the China World shopping mall. It is located a little way out of the city center.

The Shatan Hotel is near the Forbidden City and Jingshan Park, which offers views of the city. It is located on a small street with local shops and restaurants, and is within walking distance of other attractions and parks.

The Sofitel Wanda Beijing is located in the CBD/Financial area, slightly out of the center of Beijing, but within walking distance to Dawanglu Station (Line 1), a cinema, and Walmart. The hotel is near major roads, about 35 minutes from the airport, and within easy reach of Sanlitun.

The hotel is located in a quiet area next to a metro station, close to old neighborhoods with narrow streets. It is within walking distance of lakes and the drum and bell tower, but requires metro or taxi to reach Tiananmen and the Forbidden City.

Somerset ZhongGuanCun is located in the Haidian district, a 15-minute ride from the Summer Palace, and is close to subway line 10, offering access to the Olympic Park. Convenience stores and food options are nearby, with Carrefour supermarket within walking distance.

The Spring Garden Hotel is located in a Hutong (traditional Beijing alley) close to local attractions like the Forbidden City and Behai Gardens and near shops and restaurants; it has a courtyard and is decorated in a traditional Chinese style. It is near public transportation with easy access to the subway.

The Sunworld Hotel (formerly Tianlun Songhe Hotel) is centrally located near Wangfujing Street, with easy access to shopping, restaurants, and the Forbidden City/Tiananmen Square; some rooms offer views of the Forbidden City. The hotel can arrange tours to the Great Wall and Ming Tombs.

The Swissotel Beijing offers city views and is near a subway station for easy access to Beijing's attractions; some rooms on higher floors have views extending to the hills in the distance on clear days. It is located in a semi-commercial/semi-residential area with proximity to theaters and restaurants, including renovated old grain houses.

The Templeside Deluxe Hutong House is located in a traditional Beijing neighborhood (hutong), offering an authentic experience of local life. It is not in the center of things, but close to the Fuchengmen subway station for transport connections to tourist attractions.

The Aman at Summer Palace offers a secluded experience near the Summer Palace with a private entrance, but is about 45 minutes from the heart of Beijing. Guests recommend combining a stay here with a few nights in the city to experience both the property and city sites.

The Emperor Hotel is located next to the Forbidden City, offering proximity to major sites. It is within walking distance to some attractions and a short trip to the subway for others, with a rooftop bar offering views over Beijing.

The Opposite House is located in the Sanlitun Chaoyang district, near bars, restaurants, and shops, and a 10-minute walk to the Aussie embassy district. The hotel's design incorporates natural elements like wood and glass, with spacious rooms and wooden bathtubs.
The Peninsula Beijing is located within walking distance of the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square. Some reviewers recommend booking tours to the Great Wall through the concierge.
The Regent Beijing is located near shopping areas and the Forbidden City, with a subway station adjacent to the hotel. Some rooms have views of the Forbidden City.

Located in the financial district, the hotel is a 15-minute car ride from the city center and close to a major street, but some reviewers noted air pollution in the pool and hallway areas. The hotel is near a shopping mall and has a spa with a swimming pool.

The Ritz-Carlton Beijing is located in the Chaoyang District, close to the CBD and next to a high-end shopping mall, with the subway nearby. It is about 1.5 hours from the Great Wall and a short cab ride to other sites, such as Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City.

The hotel is located near embassy row, close to parks and the subway, with some rooms offering views and convenient access to both the city and nearby garden strolls. It is a 30-minute walk or a short cab ride to Tiananmen Square and other sights.
The hotel is located near a metro station, providing simple transport to different parts of the city, and is close to the airport by taxi. Some rooms offer vistas of the city.

The Westin Beijing Financial Street is located a 5-minute walk to the subway and taxis are always available and cheap; not located near the main tourist sites. It is in the Financial District so it is away from the crowds but a 10-15 min subway ride to tourist attractions.

The Tianlun Dynasty Hotel is centrally located on Wangfujing Street, within walking distance of Tiananmen Square, the Forbidden City, and shopping areas; some rooms offer views of the Forbidden City. The hotel has an inner atrium with palm trees and fountains.

The Tian Rui Hotel is located on a quiet hutong off Wangfujing Street, close to a subway station and within walking distance of the night market and pedestrian street. It is also situated near other hutongs with trees, offering a glimpse into local Beijing life away from the city's bustle.
The Tiantan Hotel is near the Temple of Heaven and a 20-minute walk from the Pearl Market. It is not located in a vibrant neighborhood and requires a taxi to reach dinner options and other sites.

The hotel is located between the 3rd and 4th ring in Beijing, near the China World Trade building, and is close to the subway, Silk Market, Forbidden City, and Tiananmen Square. Some reviewers noted ongoing construction nearby.

The Traders Upper East hotel is located halfway between the Beijing airport and the city center. It is situated in the new business district, which is a 5-minute taxi ride to offices, but far from tourist attractions.

The hotel is located near the Forbidden City and Wangfujing shopping street, with some rooms offering views of the Forbidden City; however, the Great Wall is also accessible via a car ride arranged by the concierge. The hotel is centrally located for exploring Beijing, but some reviewers noted issues with noise and air quality.

The hotel is located near university sites in a neighborhood that, while safe, is described as rundown and uninteresting, a long way from central Beijing; it is convenient to Tsinghua University (20-minute walk) and the WuDaoKou subway station (10-minute walk), which provides access to the airport express and the city.
The hotel is within walking distance to the Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square, and taxis to the Summer Palace are inexpensive. Some rooms have views of the city, and there is a pool, spa, and gym.

Xinyuan Inn is located in a hutong and offers a view of the Drum Tower, with access to bus lines for sights and a 15-20 minute walk to the subway; Cycle China's 'Best-sell One Day Secret Great Wall Hike' is recommended for those who enjoy the outdoors and hiking.

The XiXI Youyi Hotel is located a mile west of Tiananmen Square and a 10-minute walk from the Xidan Subway station on Line 1, one of the city's main shopping districts; panoramic views of Beijing are available from the corner rooms on the 10th floor. A supermarket is next door to the hotel.

The Xiyuan Hotel is located across the street from the zoo and near a quiet tree-lined canal, but it is a long drive from the airport and far from the central city where most tourist attractions are located. The Purple Bamboo Park is also within walking distance.

The hotel is located in Haidan (University District) and is a 5-minute taxi/ 7-8 minute bus ride to the nearest Underground station (XiZhiMen), which allows for commuting into central Beijing. There is also a supermarket across the road and a large market nearby.

The Zhong An Hotel is located in a hutong near the Beijing Railway Station, offering convenient access to the subway and attractions like Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. Some reviewers mention nearby markets and the ability to rent bikes for exploring the city.
